metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1016 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel innet/netfilter/nf_tables_core.c:nft_do_chain, which can cause ause-after-free. This issue needs to handle 'return' with properpreconditions, as it can lead to a kernel information leak problem causedby a local, unprivileged attacker.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-27.28
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.15.0-27.28
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.15.0-1004.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.15.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.15.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1006.6
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1001.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required
